Description:
Years of dedicated study have yielded results, though the scholarship of the dark arts is not akin to the arcane. Standing before you is a woman who does not manipulate the strings of magic - no, she destroys them, weaving a tunnel of sorts to an unfathomable source of eldrich energy that pulses ominously around her, stirring unease into your soul. Out of nowhere, she laughs, and her features soften into a kind smile directed at you. Despite society's rejection, she is no monster. She, too, is human, with emotions and heart, however dark it may be.
Warlocks are practicioners of the occult or outer magic and techniques beyond the normal domain. Using a blade, fell magic and even stealing powers away from the enemies, each warlock has its own source for their powers, by study, persuasiveness or pure chance.
A warlock is a spellcaster attuned to the unknown and bizarre, who only needs to rest inbetween fights, and every encounter wakes the power in them anew - this time, sleep is not for the wicked.
Weapons: You are Trained in 2 Weapon Categories of choice (e.g. 1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, Shields, etc).
Proficiency Requirements: You have a number of Skills equal to your Intelligence.
Proficiencies Description: Warlocks can differ vastly from one individual to another. As such, you can choose to be Skilled in a number of non-combat activities equal to your Intelligence.

Mana.Regain: Your Mana reset after every combat.

Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells and Talents inbetween Adventures.
Spellcasting.Other: All Warlock-specific Abilities are considered Spells.
Spellcasting.Recommended Abilities Description:
Eldritch Blast is generally a good option for dishing out damage from a safe distance. Consider Deathflame Bolt an upgrade to Eldritch Blast, which you can use when you have Mana and want to deal even more damage!
Burning Breath is a decent area damage Ability, while Curse of Weakness and Curse of Pain can be very effective against large enemies that take longer to kill.
Absorb Element will come in handy for protecting your allies. Finally, if you want to use a weapon, Mastery is a great choice, since you will be able to use weapons with Charisma or Intelligence instead of Might or Dexterity.

~Warlock Mana~.Effect:
Unlike other Classes', all of your Mana regenerates 10 minutes after each Worthy combat encounter (e.g. instead of inbetween Adventures).
You gain +1 Max Mana only on Levels 3, 6 and 9 (not every Level).
~Warlock Mana~.Notes: For Feats that require you to sacrifice Mana, each Mana counts as 2 sacrificed Mana. Also, for Feats, instead of sacrificing Mana, you could sacrifice 6 Health for each Mana to sacrifice.

~Power Source~.Effect:
Your powers have an external source: a demon overlord, an unknowable eldritch entity, a blood corruption, a celestial, etc.
Pick one more Ability List to know Abilities from, which should match your power source.

Starting Abilities Description.Warlock Mana:
Warlock spell casting is somewhat different from other classes.
Your Mana regenerates inbetween combat encounters. So, for optimal play, use all your Mana every encounter!

Starting Abilities Description.Power Source: A fae spirit might give you access to the Nature List. An eldritch old god might give you ancient knowledge of the Arcane or Mysticism List, or even Bloodshed. Be creative! And make sure it's approved by the QM.

Specializations.Description: At Level 1, you can choose your specialization. Every Warlock can choose from the following Warlock specializations.
Choices: Occultist, a heavy caster of Eldritch magic that can empower their spells
Cursewielder, a user of both magic and a weapon infused with the power of their master
Summoner, specialized in calling for aid from familiars and otherworldly beings

~Power Overwhelming~.Effect: All your Eldritch Basic Spells have their ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type.
~Power Overwhelming~.Notes:
{DiceUpgrade}
For example, Eldritch Blast deals 2d10, Deathflame Bolt deals 1d12 + 1d12 + 1d10, Curse of Weakness reduces by 1d6, etc.

~Shadow Veil~.Effect: You take -50% Scourge and Psychic Damage.

~Repower~.Effect: Whenever you roll maximum on a Damage die with an Eldritch Spell on a Worthy Enemy, heal for 1.

~Darkness~.Effect: After you spend Mana, conjure (optionally) a 3x3x3 meter area of magical darkness, centered on you and this turn, you can see in magical darkness.
~Darkness~.Notes: Units inside magical darkness are Blinded, and everything done in or through the darkness has Cover.

<Agile Development>.Effect: Your Basic Spells that cost Mana and can't deal Damage cost 0 Actions for you. Works only once per turn.

<Invoke Self>.Effect: Whenever you roll a d12 on a Spell, teleport 3 meters in any direction.
<Invoke Self>.Notes: You need Line of Sight to the destination point.

<Source Control>.Effect: Choose any other Basic Abilities List you have. Power Overwhelming applies to Abilities from that List as well.

<Blood Pact>.Effect: This turn, all Damage you deal is increased by 50%. Every time you roll an 8 or higher on a die, take 5 Psychic Damage.
<Blood Pact>.Notes: The 50% increase is not applied to the 5 Psychic Damage.

<Extra Power>.Effect: Your Power Overwhelming makes your ^Dice^ further ^Upgraded^ to the next die type.

<Life Drain>.Effect:
Whenever ^YOU^ kill a Worthy Enemy, heal an Ally (or yourself) for the excess Damage.
In addition, if an Enemy has 25% or less Health, you know exactly how much Health it has (ask the QM).
<Life Drain>.Notes: E.g. if the enemy has 10 Health, and you deal 16 Damage, heal an ally for 6 Health.

<Stat Bonus 5>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Great Talent Bonus>.Effect: Gain one more Level 3 Talent, and one more Level 5 Talent.

<Final Word>.Effect: When you have exactly 1 Mana, and you cast a Spell that cost 1 Mana, that Spell casts twice (for free).
<Final Word>.Notes: This is akin to casting the Spell again for 0 Actions without spending Mana (not necessarily on the same target).

~Sentient Weapon~.Effect:
You have a Cursewielder Weapon - a special weapon of one chosen type (e.g. Shortsword, Longbow, Pike, etc). This weapon will have extra effects later on. Don't lose it!
You gain Training in one more weapon type of choice.
You gain +1 in Might or Dexterity, up to +3.
~Sentient Weapon~.Upgrade: Reposess: By spending 1 hour, you can transfer the entity posessing your Cursewielder weapon into another weapon. That new weapon becomes your Cursewielder Weapon, and the old one is destroyed.
~Sentient Weapon~.Notes:
You are bound by soul to your Cursewielder Weapon, inside which your patron's avatar lies, either possessing the weapon, being trapped inside it or using it as a means of communication with you.
You must choose your weapon type when you become a Cursewielder Warlock.
You can customize your weapon's personality, voice, the way it looks. Talk to your QM about this.

~Cursewielder~.Effect: After you cast a Spell that costs Mana, your next weapon attack deals 1d6 extra Damage (within 5 minutes).
~Cursewielder~.Notes: You can only add the 1d6 once per turn. The d6's can stack (from multiple Spells that cost Mana, one after another).

<Shapeshifting Weapon>.Effect: Instantly change the type of weapon of your Cursewielder.

<Curseweave>.Effect: After you attack with your Cursewielder Weapon, if your next Act is a Damaging Spell that costs Mana, it deals +1d6 Damage (within 5 minutes).
<Curseweave>.Notes: Applies to Area Damage, but only applies once to Spells that hit multiple times (e.g. Magic Missile-like Spells, Damage over time effects, etc).

<Cursehelix>.Effect: You now have 1 more Cursewielder Weapon, of any kind. The same patron or another one of the same type is possessing your second weapon.
<Cursehelix>.Upgrade: Once per turn, for 0 Actions, you can vanish or resummon one of them.

<Hungering Weapon>.Effect: When YOU drop a Worthy Enemy to 0 Health, gain an extra Half-Action this turn and 5 Shielding.

<Spell Tap>.Effect: Every Worthy Combat, the moment you drop to 0 Mana, gain Shielding equal to your Max Mana and you can immediately freely (for 0 Actions) cast a Spell that doesn't cost Mana.

<Somatic Pulse>.Effect:
Count the Units within 3 meters of you (except you).
They are all attacked for 1d4 + (d4's equal to the number of Units) Pulse Damage.
<Somatic Pulse>.Notes: E.g. if this affects 2 Units, it deals 3d4. If it affects 3 Units, it deals 4d4. 4 Units - 5d4. And so on.

<Hexdrain>.Effect: Your Cursewielder (or Curseweave) Damage and heals you for the Damage done.

<Quick Hex>.Effect: Your Spells that cost Mana and can't deal Damage take 0 Actions for you, and your Cursewielder applies after you cast ^any^ Spell that costs Mana, not just offensive ones.

<Possessio>.Effect:
You become possessed by your patron or power source. While possessed, you have 1 extra Action on your turn and can't spend Mana, but you can't control your character - your patron or power source controls it (the QM).
You can suggest Actions for your possession, but your patron may act randomly or unpredictibly.
You still roll any dice for Acts your character make.
Lasts until the end of your next turn.

<Stat Bonus 5>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Great Talent Bonus>.Effect: Gain one more Level 3 Talent, and one more Level 5 Talent.

~Flow Tap~.Effect: Choose an enemy Unit. Cast the last Ability it cast with its exact numbers (can include attacks).
~Flow Tap~.Notes: Includes weapon attacks, multiattacks and spells. You can't cast Reactions. If you copied an attack, you briefly conjure a weapon for the attack only.

<Control Crowds>.Effect: Use when an enemy Unit uses an Ability. It must use a different Ability.
<Control Crowds>.Notes: If it has only one Ability or attack, you can't use Control Crowds (the QM will let you know).

<Soul Drain>.Effect:
Deal 8 Scourge Damage to a Unit.
If it dies and it was Worthy, you get the Mana back and heal you or an ally for half of the Damage done.
<Soul Drain>.Upgrade: Also, passively, you always know if a Unit would die from this (the QM will answer yes or no).

<Mana Flow Tapping>.Effect: If Flow Tap is on Cooldown, you can spend 1 Mana to cast it regardless.

<Power Tap>.Effect:
Cast an Ability one of your Allies has (with that ability's Actions and Costs and your modifiers).
If it costs Mana, you must spend its Mana.
<Power Tap>.Notes:
Does not work on Passives. The Ability must have 0, a Half-Action or 1 Actions cost.
The Cooldown applies to you - you can Power Tap an Ability that's on Cooldown. After you use it, it goes on Cooldown for you, not for your Ally.

<Patron Aspect>.Effect:
You take on the shape or a being from your patron's plane until the end of your next turn.
Your Basic Spells require no mana to cast.
After you cast a Basic Spell, it goes on a Once / Adventure Cooldown (can't be used until the next Adventure).

<Redirection>.Effect: Use when an Unit uses an Ability or attacks. Redirect it to any other valid Unit (e.g. within range). Its Damage or Healing is reduced by 50%.

<Nuissance to Gods>.Cooldown: All your Abilities with "Once / Combat" Cooldown can be used Twice / Encounter instead.

<Possession>.Effect:
Choose a Unit you can see.
You possess its body and, on its next turn, you control what it does.
<Possession>.Upgrades:
Only works on targets with Sense less than 3.
The QM will tell you what the Unit can do if it's a monster.

<Stat Bonus 5>.Effect: Gain +1 in a Stat of choice, up to +5.

<Advanced Talent Bonus>.Effect: Gain one more Level 3 Talent, ^or^ one more Level 5 Talent.
